p: All the morphologically identified bacterial endophytes were of Pseudomonas sp. The isolate of interest (Isolate 1) exhibited 99% similarity with Pseudomonas aureuginosa CP043328.1. Most studies have reported that Pseudomonas sp. are one of the main endophytic bacteria often found associated with most of the medicinal plants. Thus, our study affirmed these reports. Endophytic Pseudomonas sp. have been used as biocontrols against phytopathogens [ 45].
